criteria: Ability to differentiate between statistical and non-statistical questions.
Understanding of variability in data related to statistical questions.
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of statistical questions. Unable to identify any statistical questions.
Student shows minimal understanding. Struggles to differentiate between statistical and non-statistical questions; makes frequent errors.
Student demonstrates some understanding. Can identify simple statistical questions but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Student demonstrates adequate understanding. Can generally differentiate between statistical and non-statistical questions with occasional errors.
Student demonstrates strong understanding. Can accurately differentiate between statistical and non-statistical questions in most scenarios.
Student demonstrates excellent understanding. Can consistently and accurately differentiate between statistical and non-statistical questions, and explains the reasoning clearly.
Student does not recognize the concept of variability in data related to statistical questions.
Student shows minimal recognition of variability; does not understand how it relates to statistical questions.
Student demonstrates some awareness of variability but struggles to explain its relevance to statistical questions.
Student adequately understands variability and its relevance, but the explanation may lack clarity.
Student demonstrates strong understanding of variability and can explain its relevance to statistical questions with good clarity.
Student demonstrates excellent understanding of variability and provides a clear, insightful explanation of its relevance to statistical questions.
Student is unable to generate any statistical questions.
Student attempts to generate statistical questions but they are not well-formed or appropriate.
Student can generate some statistical questions, but they may be simplistic or lack clear variability.
Student can generate adequate statistical questions that demonstrate some understanding of variability.
Student can generate strong statistical questions that clearly demonstrate understanding of variability and relevance.
Student can generate excellent and insightful statistical questions that demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of variability and its implications.
